segments.text: I can’t believe how oblivious the woman is to the water pouring all over the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is about to fall, and she doesn’t even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for her cookie, completely unaware of the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading everywhere, and it’s only going to get worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are so focused on the cookies that they don’t care about anything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to tip over, and the boy is going to get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I almost want to yell at them to be careful, but I know they can’t hear me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is so chaotic, but the woman is completely calm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off the faucet before the kitchen is completely flooded.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between the calm garden and the chaos inside is almost funny.
segments.speaker: PAR
